item.title: Ticket #645 (Kubrick theme does not display correct rss comment feed link on in ...) updated
item.dc:creator: schultemn
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #645 (Kubrick theme does not display correct rss comment feed link on in ...) created
item.dc:creator: schultemn
item.description:
On line 29 of wp-content/themes/default/single.php we see:

You can follow any responses to this entry through the <a href="<?php bloginfo_rss('comments_rss2_url'); ?>">R SS 2.0</a>

What it should say is:

You can follow any responses to this entry through the <?php comments_rss_link('RSS 2.0'); ?>

item.title: Ticket #644 (No atom enclosures, rss2 empty content) updated
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: Owner, Status, Resolution changed

item.title: Ticket #249 (Password protected entries don't show comment area) updated
item.dc:creator: schultemn
item.description:
This seems to be related to the kubrick theme; I have the same problem with kubrick (in 1.5 as well) and when I go back to the classic theme the comments are shown with the correct password.

Probably has to do with how the kubrick comments.php is structured?

Somewhere in here, perhaps:

<?php Do not delete these lines

if ('comments.php' == basename($_SERVERSCRIPT_FILENAME?))

die ('Please do not load this page directly. Thanks!');

if (!empty($post->post_password)) { if there's a password

if ($_COOKIE['wp-postpass_'.$cookiehash] != $post->post_password) { and it doesn't match the cookie

?>

item.title: Ticket #644 (No atom enclosures, rss2 empty content) updated
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #644 (No atom enclosures, rss2 empty content) created
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: The atom feed doesn't include enclosures, and in rss2, if the blog is set to use full text feeds, and the post body is empty, then the feed shows up blank. It should check the body length, and use the excerpt if 0.

item.title: Ticket #639 (" / " being placed before " ' " in posts and comments) updated

item.description: I fixed the problem with a set_ini setting on magic quotes

item.title: Ticket #641 (Comment author URL broken if no http:// prefix) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: If the comment author doesn't specify ​http:// in their URL, WP creates links that are relative to the current site location. This works fine in 1.2.2, but not in the nightly (1/7) that I'm testing with.

item.title: Ticket #640 (Blog URL being added to URLs in post) updated
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Sorry, I am using the Wordpress 1-6-05 nightly

item.title: Ticket #639 (" / " being placed before " ' " in posts and comments) updated
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Sorry, I am using the Wordpress 1-6-05 nightly

item.title: Ticket #640 (Blog URL being added to URLs in post) updated
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #640 (Blog URL being added to URLs in post) created
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description:
When a URL is posted in a blog entry or comment to a blog entry it is preceded by the URL to the blog.

Example:

The blog posting from is ​http://blog.com

When this is posted in a blog or comment ​http://out.com it ends up in the post as being linked to ​http://blog.com/\http://out.com

If the post or comment is edited this issue goes away.

item.title: Ticket #639 (" / " being placed before " ' " in posts and comments) updated
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #639 (" / " being placed before " ' " in posts and comments) created
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Whenever I post a word containing " ' " such as " It's " or someone comments with the same symbol, when posted it shows up as " It/'s " (the slash is placed in the word for some reason). This happens every time the symbol is used.

item.title: Ticket #638 ("PingBack the URLs in this post" checkbox gone.) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #638 ("PingBack the URLs in this post" checkbox gone.) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
I just noticed this today: The pingback checkbox has been removed.

Why did the pingback checkbox move to a hidden field in edit-form.php v1.29 and edit-form-advanced.php v1.31?

Also, the value of the input is fixed at 1: ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=329 . Should the value depend on default_pingback_flag?

A hidden field is fine in edit-form.php, but there should be a checkbox in edit-form-advanced.php since "These settings may be overridden for individual articles" (Options -> Discussion).

item.dc:creator: qjb
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #637 (Multiple-Page Post doesn't work) created
item.dc:creator: qjb
item.description:
I write a post use quicktag "page", which will insert "<!--nextpage-->" in the post, publish is complete no problem, but user can only display the first page, when click on other page number, always return the following message:

"Sorry, no posts matched your criteria."

item.title: Ticket #635 (Log out doesn't work in Firefox) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #635 (Log out doesn't work in Firefox) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Using Firefox 1.0 and using WP 1.5 and when I click log out, It doesn't log me out. It just still makes me logged in. The thing I did to solve it was I had to delete my site cookies and It worked.

Its a big pain so Please fix it. This only occurs in Firefox :).

item.title: Ticket #634 (Kubrick: 'WordPress' Meta link contains unnecessary <abbr> tag) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #634 (Kubrick: 'WordPress' Meta link contains unnecessary <abbr> tag) created
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description:
In the default Kubrick-style theme, the last link in the 'Meta' list, titled 'WordPress', contains an unnecessary <abbr> tag:

<li><a href=""><abbr title="WordPress">WordPress</abbr></a></li>

item.title: Ticket #633 (Users at the same level can edit each others posts.) updated
item.dc:creator: iceburn
item.description:
Patch changed

Create 2 users at level 1. Post as one user. Login as second user and edit that post.

item.title: Ticket #633 (Users at the same level can edit each others posts.) created
item.dc:creator: iceburn
item.description: According to the documentation, readme, etc users of a higher rank should be able to edit the posts / comments of users at a lower rank, however users of the same rank should not be able to edit each others posts...and in 1.2.2 (downloaded yesterday) this is the case.

item.title: Ticket #631 ("mclude" in Staticize Reloaded injects ABSPATH) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #631 ("mclude" in Staticize Reloaded injects ABSPATH) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: When you use the "mclude" method to specify a file for dynamic inclusion when using Staticize Reloaded, the plugin injects ABSPATH constant before the path you specify. Shouldn't we just let the user supply the path? Many files I include have nothing to do with WP and are in a totally different place. I don't want to have to bother with some complicated relative path.

But the "/author/" thing might still be nice.

To create a new POT file, you may want to refer to ​http://wiki.wordpress.org/?pagename=POTscript

Marking this bug as resolved.

item.title: Ticket #407 (import-mt.php does not recognise breaks between entries) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
Status changed

Imported text file requested.

item.title: Ticket #407 (import-mt.php does not recognise breaks between entries) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
I tried 3 different MT text export files against the latest CVS. All of them imported fine.

Can you please upload the exact text file (or a part of it, containing more than one post) here, so I can try to reproduce the error?

A major bug is something that deserves immediate attention and that prevents the normal operation of the program. The importer is a script that adds functionality to the rest of WordPress, and hence it was marked as "minor".

Thank you for the report.
